dt: {bc}a group, body, or mass composed of many distinct parts or individuals

dt.t: A galaxy is an {wi}aggregation{/wi} of stars and gas.

dt: {bc}the collecting of units or parts into a mass or whole

et: Middle English {it}aggreciacioun{/it} "process of adding numbers, gathering of pus or humors," borrowed from Late Latin {it}aggregātiōn-, aggregātiō{/it} "gathering together," from Latin {it}aggregāre{/it} "to cause to flock together, {et_link|aggregate:2|aggregate:2}" + {it}-tiōn-, -tiō,{/it} suffix of action nouns
shortdef: a group, body, or mass composed of many distinct parts or individuals
the collecting of units or parts into a mass or whole
the condition of being so collected

dt: {bc}any of various conventional devices (such as braces, brackets, parentheses, or vinculums) used in mathematics to indicate that two or more terms are to be treated as one quantity

shortdef: any of various conventional devices (such as braces, brackets, parentheses, or vinculums) used in mathematics to indicate that two or more terms are to be treated as one quantity
